byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and YAMICHE ALCINDOR

abstract: Previously civil Democratic presidential campaigns by Sen Bernie Sanders and Hillary Clinton shift into more fractious attacks on each other's credentials, with Sanders arguing Clinton's positions on Iraq and trade make her unqualified to be president; change in tone hints that it may be difficult to unite Democrats during nomination process, possibly hurting party's ability to rally against Republicans in general election.

headline.print_headline: Democratic Race Turns to Attacks on Credentials
headline.main: Bernie Sanders and Hillary Clinton Turn to Attacks on Credentials

snippet: In a change in tenor that may indicate difficulty in unifying Democrats, Mr. Sanders said Mrs. Clinton was unqualified to be president.
lead_paragraph: In a change in tenor that may indicate difficulty in unifying Democrats, Mr. Sanders said Mrs. Clinton was unqualified to be president.
